trans-unit.source: Represents a security token that is based upon a Kerberos ticket that is sent in an SOAP request.

Typically, application developers do not need to use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> class, unless a Web service must get the service principal name associated with the Kerberos ticket.
To get the value of the service principal name, get the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.ServicePrincipalName%2A> property.

There are two classes that represent security tokens that are based upon a Kerberos ticket: <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosReceiverSecurityToken>.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> security token is used by clients that use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> security token in an outgoing SOAP messages, whereas the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosReceiverSecurityToken> security token is used by a Web service that receives SOAP messages that contain the security token.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> class using a service that is associated with the specified service principal name.

The service principal name must be in one of the following formats: `host/<hostname>@<domain>` or `<hostname>`, where `hostname` is the name of the computer hosting the target Web service and `domain` is the fully-qualified domain name of the Kerberos realm in which the host computer resides.
The service principal name is associated with an account that is running the service and this mapping is stored in the Kerberos Domain Controller (KDC).
The service principal name for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.ServicePrincipalName"></xref> property.
servicePrincipalName is `null`.
A Kerberos ticket cannot be obtained for the current user.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> class.

The service principal name must be in one of the following formats: `host/<hostname>@<domain>` or `<hostname>`, where `hostname` is the name of the computer hosting the target Web service and `domain` is the fully-qualified domain name of the Kerberos realm in which the host computer resides.
The service principal name is associated with an account that is running the service and this mapping is stored in the Kerberos Domain Controller (KDC).
When `null` is passed into the `networkCredential` parameter, a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> security token is obtained for the current user.
The service principal name for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.ServicePrincipalName"></xref> property.

One of the <xref href="System.Security.Principal.TokenImpersonationLevel"></xref> values that specifies how the client allows the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token to be impersonated.
A <xref href="System.Net.NetworkCredential"></xref> that specifies the user to get a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token for.
A unique identifier of the security token.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.Id"></xref> property.
servicePrincipalName is `null`.
-or-
id is `null`.
networkCredential is not `null`, not equal to and the property is empty or `null`.
A Kerberos ticket cannot be obtained for the specified user.
tokenImpersonationLevel is not `Impersonation` or `Identity`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this security token is capable of creating the specified key identifier.
To create the key identifier clause, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.CreateKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that specifies the key identifier to create.
`true` when T is of type ; otherwise, `false`.
Creates the specified key identifier clause.

To determine whether the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> class can create the specified key identifier clause, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that specifies the key identifier to create.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that is a key identifier clause for the security token.
Gets the Kerberos ticket request.
The Kerberos ticket request is made using the `InitializeSecurityContext` API.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the result Kerberos ticket request.
Gets a unique identifier of the security token.
A unique identifier of the security token.
Returns a value that indicates whether the key identifier for this instance matches the specified key identifier.
`true` if skiClause is of type and the results of the Kerberos ticket request match; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the symmetric session key for the Kerberos ticket that is associated with this security token.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.SecurityKey%2A> property is set when one of the constructors is called with the symmetric session key for the Kerberos ticket that is obtained for the specified user.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SymmetricSecurityKey"></xref> that contains the symmetric session key for the Kerberos ticket that is associated with this security token.
Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.SecurityKeys%2A> property contains the symmetric session key in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosReceiverSecurityToken.SecurityKey%2A> property.

A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey"></xref> that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.
Gets the service principal name for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token.

The service principal name may be in one of the following formats: `host/<hostname>@<domain>` or `<hostname>`, where `hostname` is the name of the computer hosting the target Web service and `domain` is the fully-qualified domain name of the Kerberos realm in which the host computer resides.
The service principal name for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is set to the instant in time when the Kerberos ticket is obtained in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.
Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is set to the instant in time when the Kerberos ticket expires in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
